Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a carinated double-convex body, a short rounded nozzle flanked by volutes, and a small filling-hole surrounded by a double moulding. The wide rounded shoulder is decorated with chevron patterns, and on the nozzle top is a thyrsos or thunderbolt. Within the pseudo-base-ring is an impressed letter I.
Curator's comments: Was included as Q603; dated too early.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2089)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
